title: Paul Rudd surprises Friends fans by admitting he's barely watched ANY of the beloved sitcom
text:
Friends may be a beloved classic.

But Paul Rudd doesn't want to talk about the 90s sitcom.

The Ant-man actor, 50, admitted he hasn't even seen a majority of the show while appearing on Radio 1 Breakfast in the UK on Tuesday.

Not quite there for you... Paul Rudd admitted he's barely seen any episodes of Friends while appearing on Radio 1 Breakfast in the UK on Tuesday

During the show's Unpopular Opinions segment a fan called in to suggest that How I Met You Mother was better than Friends.

It was then that the truth came out.

'I have a bit of a biased perspective on this one, I think,' Rudd giggled before admitting: 'I'm really not so familiar with the episodes.'

Pressed on how much of the show he actually had seen, Paul - who played Lisa Kudrow's character Phoebe's third husband, Mike Hannigan, on the show - revealed: 'I don't know... Not that many. I never watched.'

Paul played Lisa Kudrow's character Phoebe's love interest turned third husband, Mike Hannigan, during the later seasons of the show

Wow! While Paul was keeping an arm's length towards the series, the rest of the Friends were happy to reunite recently, as seen on Jennifer Aniston's brand new Instagram

While Paul was keeping an arm's length towards the series, the rest of the Friends were happy to reunite recently.

In Jennifer Aniston's inaugural Instagram Tuesday, she shared a cast reunion photo.

Her very first post showed her beaming while alongside her co-stars Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry and David Schwimmer.

Here she is! She confirmed in the snap that the post was her social media debut

The post helped Jennifer rake in so many followers she actually cause her page to crash, completely halting fans from following her account.

But things didn't stay that way for long. Despite the hiccups, Aniston actually beat the world record for earning 1million followers in the least amount of time.

She reached seven figures in just five-hours and 16 minutes, beating previous record setters Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's record of five hours and 45 minutes.
description: Friends may be a beloved classic but that hasn't stopped Paul Rudd from avoiding the sitcom. He admitted he's barely ever seen the show while sitting down for Radio 1 Breakfast Tuesday.
